com.dsi.ant.plugins
Class AntPluginPcc

java.lang.Object
  com.dsi.ant.plugins.AntPluginPcc
Direct Known Subclasses:
AntPlusBikeSpeedPcc, AntPlusCommonPcc, AntPlusFitPcc, AntPlusGeocachePcc, AntPlusHeartRatePcc, AntPlusWeightScalePcc
public abstract class AntPluginPcc
extends java.lang.Object

Defines the base interface and common routines to all PCCs.

Nested Class Summary
static interface AntPluginPcc.IDeviceStateChangeReceiver
          Allows clients to receive state updates of an accessed device.
static interface AntPluginPcc.IPluginAccessResultReceiver<T extends AntPluginPcc>
          Allows clients to receive the results from all the access request functions.
static class AntPluginPcc.RequestAccessResultHandler<T extends AntPluginPcc>
          Used to define how the request access results are handled.
static class AntPluginPcc.RequestAccessResultHandlerAsyncSearch<T extends AntPluginPcc>
          Extended access result handler that implements handling of the SEARCHTIMEOUT code.
static class AntPluginPcc.RequestAccessResultHandlerUI<T extends AntPluginPcc>
          Extended access result handler that implements handling of the REQACTIVITYLAUNCH code to launch the specified activity.

Constructor Detail

AntPluginPcc

public AntPluginPcc()
Method Detail

getAntDeviceID

public int getAntDeviceID()
Retrieves the deviceID of the device accessed by this PCC.

Returns:
The ANT channel deviceID of the device this PCC is accessing. If the value is negative it means the plugin does not support this function.

getCurrentDeviceState

public int getCurrentDeviceState()
Retrieves the current device state.

Returns:
The AntPluginMsgDefines.DeviceStateCodes of the current device state.

getDeviceName

public java.lang.String getDeviceName()
Retrieves the name of the device accessed by this PCC.

Returns:
The name of the device this PCC is accessing.

getMissingDependencyName

public static java.lang.String getMissingDependencyName()
Retrieves the display name of the last reported missing dependency. When the result of requesting access is AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatDEPENDENCYNOTINSTALLED, this function can be used to retrieve the display name of the missing required package. This name can be used to display to the user the missing dependency.

Returns:
The display name of the last reported missing dependency.

getMissingDependencyPackageName

public static java.lang.String getMissingDependencyPackageName()
Retrieves the package name of the last reported missing dependency. When the result of requesting access is AntPluginMsgDefines.MSG_REQACC_RESULT_whatDEPENDENCYNOTINSTALLED, this function can be used to retrieve the package name of the missing required package. This package name can be used to acquire the required package from the Play Store or elsewhere.

Returns:
The package name of the last reported missing dependency.

releaseAccess

public void releaseAccess()
Signals plugin to release our access to the device and shuts down this PCC. This function should be called to close every PCC obtained in a successful access request when an application is done using the PCC or the application is closing.

requestAccess_Helper

public static <T extends AntPluginPcc> void requestAccess_Helper(Activity foregroundActivity,
                                                                 Context bindingContext,
                                                                 boolean skipPreferredSearch,
                                                                 T retPccObject,
                                                                 AntPluginPcc.IPluginAccessResultReceiver<T> resultReceiver,
                                                                 AntPluginPcc.IDeviceStateChangeReceiver stateReceiver)
This overload requests the plugin to show UI showing the connection progress and handling interacting with the user

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the PCC being requested.
Parameters:
foregroundActivity - The current foreground activity that an activity can be launched from.
bindingContext - The context to which the plugin will be bound. Used for plugin lifecycle management.
skipPreferredSearch - True = Don't automatically connect to user's preferred device, but always go to search for other devices.
retPccObject - The potential PCC to be returned, needed to hook up the plugin IPC before the result is returned.
resultReceiver - The receiver to receive the results of the request.
stateReceiver - The receiver to receive the state updates of the accessed device, assuming the request is successful. This receiver will receive notifications of all state changes to the device that occur subsequent to the initial state returned in the result receiver.

requestAccess_Helper

public static <T extends AntPluginPcc> void requestAccess_Helper(Context bindingContext,
                                                                 Bundle reqParams,
                                                                 T retPccObject,
                                                                 AntPluginPcc.RequestAccessResultHandler<T> reqAccessResultHandler,
                                                                 AntPluginPcc.IPluginAccessResultReceiver<T> resultReceiver,
                                                                 AntPluginPcc.IDeviceStateChangeReceiver stateReceiver)
Sends the request to the plugin service activity to give us access to a device

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the PCC being requested.
Parameters:
bindingContext - The context to which the plugin will be bound. Used for plugin lifecycle management.
reqParams - The bundle containing the access specific parameters. The default parameters will be added to this bundle and sent as the request.
retPccObject - The potential PCC to be returned, needed to hook up the plugin IPC before the result is returned.
reqAccessResultHandler - The access result handler implementation to handle the responses from the plugin.
resultReceiver - The receiver to receive the results of the request.
stateReceiver - The receiver to receive the state updates of the accessed device, assuming the request is successful. This receiver will receive notifications of all state changes to the device that occur subsequent to the initial state returned in the result receiver.

requestAccess_Helper

public static <T extends AntPluginPcc> void requestAccess_Helper(Context bindingContext,
                                                                 int antDeviceID,
                                                                 T retPccObject,
                                                                 AntPluginPcc.IPluginAccessResultReceiver<T> resultReceiver,
                                                                 AntPluginPcc.IDeviceStateChangeReceiver stateReceiver)
This overload requests connecting to a specific deviceID. If the deviceID is 0, this request is for the first available/found device.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the PCC being requested.
Parameters:
bindingContext - The context to which the plugin will be bound. Used for plugin lifecycle management.
antDeviceID - The device ID of the device to search for.
retPccObject - The potential PCC to be returned, needed to hook up the plugin IPC before the result is returned.
resultReceiver - The receiver to receive the results of the request.
stateReceiver - The receiver to receive the state updates of the accessed device, assuming the request is successful. This receiver will receive notifications of all state changes to the device that occur subsequent to the initial state returned in the result receiver.

statusCodeToPrintableString

public static java.lang.String statusCodeToPrintableString(int code)
Converts a AntPluginMsgDefines.DeviceStateCodes to a printable word.

Parameters:
code - The device state code to convert.
Returns:
The string representation of the give state code.
